ventserver.io.trio package¶

Modules for trio I/O endpoint drivers and execution synchronizers.

Modules:

endpoints: abstract interface for I/O endpoint drivers. _serial: I/O endpoint driver for serial connections. websocket: I/O endpoint driver for WebSocket server connections to clients. channels: support for trio MemoryChannels in a Filter-like interface.

Submodules¶

ventserver.io.trio.channels module¶

Trio-backed channel implementations.

Push a data item onto the channel.

Finishes only when the data item can be pushed onto the channel.

Pull a data item from the channel.

Finishes only when a data item can be pulled from the channel.

ventserver.io.trio.endpoints module¶

Asynchronous I/O endpoint interfaces.

class ventserver.io.trio.endpoints.IOEndpoint(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

Bases: ventserver.io.asynchronous.endpoints.IOEndpoint

Base class for sending data to and receiving data from I/O endpoints.

abstract async open(nursery: Optional[trio.Nursery] = None) → None[source]¶

Open the I/O connection.

Nursery can be used by some I/O drivers to set the nursery used for spawning child tasks and listening for connections.

async persistently_open(nursery: Optional[trio.Nursery] = None, retry_interval: float = 0) → None[source]¶

Try persistently to open the I/O connection.

Note: retry_interval=0 means that this coroutine will just hit an async checkpoint after every failed connection, to give an opportunity for other Trio tasks to run.

ventserver.io.trio.websocket module¶

Trio I/O WebSocket driver.

class ventserver.io.trio.websocket.Driver(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

Bases: ventserver.io.trio.endpoints.IOEndpoint

Implements a WebSocket I/O driver.

async close() → None[source]¶

Close the WebSocket connection.

init_server() → ventserver.io.trio.websocket.SingleConnectionService[source]¶

Initialize the server.

property is_open¶

Return whether or not the WebSocket connection is open.

async open(nursery: Optional[trio.Nursery] = None) → None[source]¶

Open WebSocket connection.

If nursery is not provided, a new nursery will be created and open() will only return after the server stops. You probably want to provide a nursery.

props: ventserver.io.websocket.WebSocketProps¶
